xxl.core.math.functions
Class RealFunctionArea

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.math.functions.RealFunctionArea
Direct Known Subclasses:
SimpsonsRuleRealFunctionArea, TrapezoidalRuleRealFunctionArea
public class RealFunctionArea
extends Object

This class wraps a RealFunction implementing Integrable in order to compute the area 'under' a given interval of the function. Real-valued functions not implementing Integrable could be integrated by applying an algorithm for numerical integration like the Trapezoidal rule or the Simpson's rule.

See Also:
RealFunction, TrapezoidalRuleRealFunctionArea, SimpsonsRuleRealFunctionArea

Method Detail

eval

public double eval(double a,
                   double b)
            throws IllegalArgumentException
Evaluates the area "under" a given RealFunction of a given interval and returns the evaluation of \int_a^b f(x) dx.

Parameters:
a - left interval border of the area to compute
b - right interval border of the area to compute
Returns:
area "under" the given real-valued function \int_a^b f(x) dx
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - invalid parameters
